option.name: fileSummaryMaps
option.value: {"D:/backend/BetterMe":"{\"/src/main/java/com/backend/BetterMe/Controller/HomeController.java\":\"This file contains a single class and a single function:\\n\\n`HomeController`: This class is a REST controller that handles HTTP requests to the root URL (`/`).\\n\\n`home()`: This function returns the string \\\"test!\\\" when the root URL (`/`) is accessed.\\n\\nOverall, this file sets up a simple Spring Boot application with a single REST endpoint that returns a static string.\",\"/src/main/java/com/backend/BetterMe/Service/ExerciseService.java\":\"This file contains the `ExerciseService` class and several functions related to managing exercises and exercise tracking.\\n\\n`ExerciseService`: A service class that provides methods for managing exercises, including adding, deleting, and retrieving exercises, as well as adding exercises to a user\\u0027s daily workout and tracking their completion.\\n\\n`addExercise`: Adds a new exercise to the master list.\\n`getAllExercises`: Lists all exercises from the master list.\\n`deleteExercise`: Deletes a selected exercise from the master list.\\n`addToTodayWorkout`: Adds an exercise to the user\\u0027s workout for the current day.\\n`getTodayExercises`: Retrieves the exercises that the user has added to their workout for the current day.\\n`markExerciseCompleted`: Marks an exercise as completed for the current day.\\n`getTodayCompletion`: Retrieves the list of exercises that the user has completed for the current day.\",\"/src/main/java/com/backend/BetterMe/Repository/ExerciseTrackerRepo.java\":\"This file defines a Spring Data JPA repository interface called `ExerciseTrackerRepo` that extends the `JpaRepository` interface. The repository provides methods to interact with the `ExerciseTracker` entity in the database.\\n\\n`ExerciseTrackerRepo`: A Spring Data JPA repository interface that provides methods to interact with the `ExerciseTracker` entity in the database.\\n\\n`findByDateAndCompletion`: Finds a list of `ExerciseTracker` entities by the given date and completion status.\\n\\n`findByDate`: Finds a list of `ExerciseTracker` entities by the given date.\\n\\n`findByExerciseIdAndDate`: Finds a list of `ExerciseTracker` entities by the given exercise ID and date.\",\"/src/main/java/com/backend/BetterMe/Model/ExerciseTracker.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `ExerciseTracker`, which is an entity class used for mapping a table in the database.\\n\\n`ExerciseTracker`: This class represents a record of an exercise performed on a specific date, and it includes information about the exercise, the date, and whether the exercise was completed.\\n\\nThe file does not contain any functions, as it is a simple entity class with properties and annotations for mapping the class to a database table.\",\"/src/main/java/com/backend/BetterMe/Repository/ExerciseRepo.java\":\"This file contains a single interface named `ExerciseRepo` that extends the `JpaRepository` interface provided by Spring Data JPA.\\n\\n`ExerciseRepo`: This interface provides a set of CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations for the `Exercise` entity.\\n\\nThe file does not contain any classes or functions. It defines a Spring Data JPA repository interface that allows for easy interaction with the `Exercise` entity in the database.\",\"/src/test/java/com/backend/BetterMe/BetterMeApplicationTests.java\":\"This file is a test class for the BetterMeApplication class in the Spring Boot application. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather a single test method `contextLoads()` that is used to ensure the application context loads successfully.\\n\\n`BetterMeApplicationTests`: A test class for the BetterMeApplication class in the Spring Boot application.\\n\\n`contextLoads()`: A test method that ensures the application context loads successfully.\",\"/src/main/java/com/backend/BetterMe/Model/Exercise.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `Exercise`, which represents the main table for exercises in the BetterMe application.\\n\\n`Exercise`: This class represents the main table for exercises in the BetterMe application, with an `id` field that is auto-generated and a `name` field that is required and unique.\\n\\nThis file does not contain any functions. It is a simple data model class that is used to define the structure of the `exercises` table in the database.\",\"/src/main/java/com/backend/BetterMe/Repository/ExerciseDetailRepo.java\":\"This file contains a repository interface for the `ExerciseDetail` model in the `BetterMe` application.\\n\\n`ExerciseDetailRepo`: This interface extends the `JpaRepository` interface and provides methods for interacting with the `ExerciseDetail` entity in the database.\\n\\n`findById(LocalDate date)`: This method is used to retrieve a list of `ExerciseDetail` entities based on the provided `LocalDate` date.\",\"/src/main/java/com/backend/BetterMe/BetterMeApplication.java\":\"This file is the main application class for the BetterMe Spring Boot application. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather serves as the entry point for the application.\\n\\nThe file does the following:\\n\\n1. Imports the necessary Spring Boot classes and annotations.\\n2. Defines the `BetterMeApplication` class, which is annotated with `@SpringBootApplication`, indicating that it is the main class for the Spring Boot application.\\n3. Provides the `main()` method, which is the entry point for the application and calls the `SpringApplication.run()` method to start the application.\",\"/src/main/java/com/backend/BetterMe/Model/ExerciseDetail.java\":\"This file defines a single class, `ExerciseDetail`, which represents the details of an exercise performed, including the number of repetitions, sets, weight, and the date when the exercise was performed.\\n\\n`ExerciseDetail`: A class that represents the details of an exercise performed, including the number of repetitions, sets, weight, and the date when the exercise was performed.\",\"/src/main/resources/templates/exercises.html\":\"This file appears to be a Thymeleaf template for a Workout Tracker web application. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather defines the structure and layout of the web page. Here\\u0027s a summary of the main elements:\\n\\n`\\u003chead\\u003e`: Defines the HTML document\\u0027s metadata, including the title and CSS styles.\\n`\\u003cbody\\u003e`: Contains the main content of the web page, including a header, a container with two sections, and various forms and lists.\\nThe left section displays a list of exercises, with options to add new exercises, add them to the current day\\u0027s workout, and delete them.\\nThe right section displays the exercises for the current day\\u0027s workout, with an option to remove them, and a completion tracker for the exercises.\\nThe template uses Thymeleaf syntax to dynamically display data and handle form submissions.\",\"/src/main/java/com/backend/BetterMe/Controller/ExerciseController.java\":\"This file contains a Spring MVC controller class for managing exercises.\\n\\n`ExerciseController`: This class handles the routing and logic for the exercise-related functionality in the application.\\n\\n`showExercises`: This function retrieves all exercises and the exercises for today, and adds them to the model for rendering in the \\\"exercises\\\" view.\\n\\n`addExercise`: This function handles the creation of a new exercise by adding it to the service.\\n\\n`deleteExercise`: This function handles the deletion of an exercise by its ID.\\n\\n`addToToday`: This function adds an existing exercise to the user\\u0027s workout for today.\",\"/HELP.md\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. It is a documentation file that provides an overview of the Spring Boot project, including reference documentation, guides, and information about Maven parent overrides.\\n\\nThe file covers the following topics:\\n\\n1. Reference Documentation: Provides links to the official Apache Maven documentation, Spring Boot Maven Plugin Reference Guide, and documentation for Spring Web and Spring Data JPA.\\n\\n2. Guides: Lists several guides that illustrate how to use specific features of the Spring framework, such as building a RESTful web service, serving web content with Spring MVC, and accessing data with JPA.\\n\\n3. Maven Parent overrides: Explains that due to Maven\\u0027s design, the project POM inherits unwanted elements like `\\u003clicense\\u003e` and `\\u003cdevelopers\\u003e` from the parent POM, and how to prevent this by including empty overrides for these elements.\"}"}
